author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Canadian Union of Postal Workers (CUPW) announced all its members are on strike Sept. 25, coming just hours after Ottawa allowed Canada Post to end door-to-door delivery for around 4 million addresses and recommended various changes to service to resolve Canada Post’s “existential crisis.” The union, which represents more than 55,000 members nationwide, made […]
title: Postal Workers’ Union Goes on Nationwide Strike After Ottawa Makes Cuts to Canada Post Service

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The leaders of Canada and Indonesia met in Ottawa for the first time in 25 years, signing agreements on trade, defence cooperation, and investment partnerships. The Sept. 24 trade deal will scrap and reduce tariffs on more than 95 percent of Canadian exports to Indonesia within eight to 12 months, while a second partnership deal […]
title: Canada and Indonesia Sign Bilateral Trade and Defence Agreements

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Quebec woman who scalded a 10-year-old boy at her door with boiling water last year, frustrated by being the victim of a doorbell prank, has pleaded guilty to aggravated assault. Stéphanie Borel, 47, entered the guilty plea at the Longueuil, Que., courthouse south of Montreal on Thursday. The Crown and defence didn’t agree on […]
title: Quebec Woman Who Scalded Young Boy Over Prank Pleads Guilty

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford criticized the federal government for filing a motion with the Supreme Court around limiting the use of the notwithstanding clause, calling it a “disaster” and saying it will likely be blocked by the provinces. “This is the worst decision Prime Minister [Mark] Carney has ever done, and it will be an […]
title: Ontario Premier Ford Says Ottawa’s Challenge of Notwithstanding Clause Amounts to ‘Overreach’

author: Zachary Stieber
description: The U.S. health secretary informed a U.N. assembly of the decision as assembly members prepared to adopt the declaration.
title: US Objects to United Nations’ Declaration on Noncommunicable Diseases: RFK Jr.

author: Dorothy Li
description: The Chinese regime is targeting six American defense companies.
title: Beijing Puts Trade Restrictions on US Companies as Friction Persists

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Convicted murderer Rabih Alkhalil has been arrested in Qatar after escaping from a B.C. jail in 2022, the RCMP says. Alkhalil, 38, was taken into custody in Qatar this month, the Combined Forces Special Enforcement Unit of British Columbia (CFSEU-BC) and the RCMP Federal Policing Pacific Region confirmed in a Sept. 25 news release. The […]
title: One of Canada’s ‘Most Wanted’ Criminals Arrested in Qatar

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of Canada’s banking regulator is warning that security risks are rising as the geopolitical landscape shifts, and says industry needs to adapt quickly. Superintendent of Financial Institutions Peter Routledge, speaking at an Institute of International Finance forum in Toronto, says the risks the financial sector faces today are not the ones he expected […]
title: Banking Regulator Warns of Rising Risks as Geopolitical Winds Shift

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prosecutors in Peterborough, Ont., have withdrawn charges against former Ontario MPP Randy Hillier related to COVID-19 gathering restrictions, according to a legal advocacy group.  Although charges against Hillier were dropped in Peterborough, they remain in place in other jurisdictions, the Justice Centre for Constitutional Freedoms (JCCF) said on Sept. 22 on social media, noting that it […]
title: COVID Charges Withdrawn Against Former Ontario MPP Hillier: JCCF

author: Chandra Philip
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford says his government will be looking to ban traffic speed cameras across the province, a move opposed by chiefs of police in the province. Ford made the announcement during a Sept. 25 press conference in Vaughan, saying his government will be introducing the related legislation this fall. “Over the last few […]
title: Speed Cameras to Be Banned Across Ontario: Premier Ford

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Wind Zone, about 10 times the size of Singapore, lies to the southwest of Perth and along the entrance of Geographe Bay.
title: Locals Warn Offshore Wind Project Threatens Whale Nursery in Geographe Bay

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Major changes are on the horizon for Canada Post, which has been deemed “insolvent” and is currently losing approximately $10 million per day, Ottawa says. The federal government is directing Canada Post to transition from door-to-door delivery to community mailboxes for four million additional addresses, Minister of Government Transformation, Public Works and Procurement Joël Lightbound […]
title: Canada Post to Reduce Mail Frequency, Restructure to Address ‘Existential Crisis’: Minister

author: Epoch Video
description: Danish defense, national police, defense intelligence, and security intelligence officials hold a press conference at 1:30 p.m. ET on Sept. 25 after drones were sighted near Danish airports.
title: REPLAY: Danish Authorities Hold News Conference After Drone Sighting

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Ukrainian leader said that he would call elections and not run for president again if a cease-fire with Moscow could be reached.
title: Zelenkskyy Ready to Step Down After War Finishes

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Liberal government is set to make its third attempt at introducing legislation to address “online harms,” similar to a bill tabled in the last Parliament, and another that was tabled in 2021, Heritage Minister Steven Guilbeault says. Guilbeault made the comments at a Sept. 24 House of Commons heritage committee meeting, saying the Liberal […]
title: Liberals to Introduce Online Harms Legislation for the Third Time: Minister Guilbeault

author: Rachel Roberts
description: France's former president said he would appeal after he was found guilty of accepting 50 million euros in the mid-2000s from Libyan dictator Moammar Gadhafi.
title: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy Sentenced to 5 Years for Libya Funding Plot

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s national security adviser says India has “absolutely” committed to co-operating and sharing information with Canadian police for ongoing investigations. Nathalie Drouin told reporters outside the cabinet room on Parliament Hill today that she had a “very productive meeting” last week with Indian government officials. Drouin travelled to India and met with […]
title: PM’s Adviser Says India Committed to Co-operating With Police Investigations

author: The Canadian Press
description: An inmate who has pleaded guilty to murdering Robert Pickton in prison last year says he did it for the serial killer’s victims. Martin Charest admitted today to fatally assaulting Pickton with a broken broom handle at the Port-Cartier federal penitentiary in May 2024. Charest pleaded guilty to first-degree murder during a court appearance in […]
title: ‘I Did It for the Victims’: Robert Pickton’s Killer Tells Court During Guilty Plea

author: The Canadian Press
description: Montreal’s fully automated light-rail network won’t open all its new lines according to plan this fall. Instead, only the branch connecting downtown’s central station to Montreal’s northwest suburbs across the river from Laval, Que., will open in November. Network operator CDPQ Infra—a subsidiary of Quebec’s pension fund manager—says the branch running to Montreal’s West Island […]
title: Branch of Montreal Light-Rail Network to Open in November, the Other Delayed to 2026

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Israel’s Foreign Ministry said the country would not permit vessels to enter an active combat zone or to breach its naval blockade.
title: Israeli Officials Say Gaza Flotilla Linked to Terrorist Organizations

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Quebec government is enacting a ban on the use of newly created gender-neutral words in all of its official communications, describing it as an effort to avoid confusion and preserve the integrity of the French language. The newly revised language policy pertains to gender-neutral pronouns frequently used by transgender individuals and those who identify […]
title: Quebec Prohibiting Gender-Neutral Pronouns in Government Documents

author: Frank Fang
description: The International Civil Aviation Organization's triennial assembly is underway in Montreal.
title: US Transportation Secretary Duffy Voices Support for Taiwan’s Participation in ICAO

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Denmark's justice minister said the aim of the flyovers was to sow 'fear and division.'
title: Denmark Weighing Up Article 4 Option Following Airport Drone Incursions

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canadians hoping to get their hands on treasures from Hudson’s Bay won’t have to wait much longer for the chance. An Ontario court approved a November sale of 1,700 pieces of art and about 2,700 artifacts belonging to the fallen retailer today. Though the company has yet to reveal exactly what will be up for […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Gets Court Permission to Auction Off Its ‘Retail Era’ Art, Artifacts

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Nearly six million Canadians are currently on a health-care waitlist, surpassing levels recorded in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic, a new report suggests. Government data obtained by think tank SecondStreet.org indicate at least 3.7 million Canadians are waiting for surgery, a diagnostic scan, or to see a specialist. But the organization is suggesting figures […]
title: Nearly 6M Canadians on Medical Waitlists as Delays Outpace Pandemic Backlog: Report

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO) estimates that the deficit for the next federal budget will increase “sharply” to $68.5 billion. In its economic outlook published Sept. 25, the PBO projects the government’s budget, set to be introduced on Nov. 4, will show the deficit is up from $51.7 billion in the 2024-25 fiscal year to […]
title: Deficit to Reach $68.5 Billion: Budget Watchdog

author: Epoch Video
description: A view of the cleanup in a Taiwan town flooded by murky waters from a mountain barrier lake that burst its banks during a typhoon, killing 17 people, on Sept. 25.
title: REPLAY: Taiwan Town Flooded After Typhoon

author: Owen Evans
description: Landlocked EU states have said alternatives are too costly and limited to replace the Druzhba pipeline, as Trump steps up pressure to cut Russian oil ties.
title: Slovakia Sides With Hungary Against Trump’s Russian Oil Phase-Out

author: Victoria Friedman
description: In July, Trump and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced they had reached a trade deal.
title: US Formally Implements EU Trade Deal Terms, Confirming 15 Percent Tariff on Automobiles

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Victoria’s crime rate has jumped faster than anywhere else in Australia, far outpacing other states.
title: Theft Drives Biggest Jump in Victoria Crime Rate in 20 Years

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Andrew Hastie said the Coalition risked further decline if it failed to win back disillusioned voters drifting to minor conservative parties.
title: Hastie Warns Liberal Party Risks ‘Extinction’ Without Tough Migration Cuts

author: Cindy Li
description: David Yeau-Tarn Lee believes that many left-leaning governments in the world mistakenly draw a superficial resemblance between the CCP and their own parties.
title: New Zealand Now ‘Awakened’ Against CCP’s Ambitions, Says China Expert

author: Michael Zhuang
description: More than 130 people, mostly children, were hospitalized in China’s southwestern Guizhou Province after eating sandwiches from a local bakery chain, in what officials have confirmed as a mass outbreak of salmonella poisoning. Parents and residents have alleged that Chinese authorities attempted to silence the story, as many online videos about the incident were removed. […]
title: Bakery Salmonella Outbreak in China Sickens More Than 130, Mostly Children, Sparks Censorship

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A former Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) employee has been charged in connection with an RCMP investigation into the unauthorized access of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s personal financial information. RBC’s computer systems were used for fraudulent and criminal activity while accessing multiple accounts including Carney’s, according to RCMP spokesperson Erique Gasse.  Gasse said police opened […]
title: Former RBC Employee Charged in Unauthorized Access of PM Carney’s Account

author: Michael Zwaagstra
description: Commentary School is back in session, and it won’t be long before students start writing unit tests, which teachers will mark and hand back with a grade. However, this won’t happen in at least one Hamilton high school because earlier this month parents received a two-page letter informing them that their children’s school was participating […]
title: Michael Zwaagstra: So-called ‘Gradeless Learning’ Fails Both Students and Taxpayers

author: Reuters
description: SAO PAULO–Chinese landscape architect Kongjian Yu died in a plane crash late on Tuesday in the vast Brazilian wetlands of Mato Grosso do Sul state, Brazilian authorities said on Wednesday. Yu, 62, gained global relevance as a landscape architect and urban planner after the Chinese regime adopted his concept of “sponge cities” using nature-based solutions […]
title: Chinese Landscape Architect Kongjian Yu Dies in Brazil Plane Crash

author: The Associated Press
description: A part of a road in Bangkok collapsed on Wednesday, leaving a large sinkhole.
title: Bangkok Road Collapse Creates Sinkhole Disrupting Traffic and Prompting Evacuations

author: The Associated Press
description: BOGOTA, Colombia—Twenty-three workers were rescued Wednesday after spending 43 hours trapped in a collapsed underground gold mine in northern Colombia. The miners were met with applause as they emerged from the La Reliquia mine, located in the Antioquia department. Colombia’s National Mining Agency reported that the main entrance to the mine had collapsed on Monday […]
title: 23 Miners Rescued After 43 Hours Trapped in Colombian Gold Mine

author: Cindy Li
description: 'Rather than fix the record ambulance ramping and patient wait at hospitals, the premier has jetted off to China for a few photo ops,' said Tshung Chang.
title: Western Australian Premier Criticised for China Trip

author: Alex Wu
description: Alternative routes can’t replace the China-Europe Railway Express mainline that goes through the Poland-Belarus border, according to analysts.
title: Poland Reopens Border With Belarus, as China Struggles to Find Alternative Trade Routes to EU

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Xi committed to absolute emission cuts and rapid green growth, but Albanese said China’s coal expansion risks locking in decades of pollution.
title: Albanese Welcomes China’s Pledge to Cut Emissions but Urges Faster Coal Exit

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: In his first national address to the UN, Albanese said 'peace is both our common cause and our collective responsibility.'
title: Albanese Ties Climate Change and Palestine to UN’s Founding Ideals

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Rubio shared his view on the coordinated decision of Australia, the UK, Canada and France to recognise a Palestinian state.
title: Rubio Says High Migration Numbers Creating Local Pressure to Recognise Palestine

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: University professors voiced opposing views on federal funding based on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) criteria that have become increasingly prevalent in academia as they appeared in a House of Commons committee on Sept. 24. Canadian academic Gad Saad, along with professor Eric Kaufmann, said that “woke” policies are harming academic integrity and depriving funding […]
title: Professors Testify on DEI Research Funding Criteria Before MPs

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Price called for her colleagues who background against conservatives to 'put their name to those comments that they like to make anonymously.'
title: Jacinta Price Backs Andrew Hastie as a Future Leader, Calls for Stop to Backgrounding

author: Melanie Sun
description: The deal with Beijing could see China recommit to buying more Boeing jets.
title: US Ambassador Says Potential China Deal With Boeing ‘Very Important’ to Trump
